sentences.en: Everyone thought Annabel was being snooty.
sentences.cn: 人人都认为安娜贝尔太目中无人。

sentences.en: Harry picked up his wine glass and sipped, putting on a fake snooty wine - taster accent.
sentences.cn: Harry拿起了他的酒杯,啜饮着, 假装着那种傲慢的品酒者的口音.

sentences.en: Having won the tennis championship, she has become more and more snooty.
sentences.cn: 得了网球冠军以后, 她越来越高傲了.

sentences.en: He's too snooty to associate with his old friends now he's rich.
sentences.cn: 他现在富有了竟然傲慢的不屑与老朋友交往了.

sentences.en: I didn't like the way you looked at May Arnold , or the snooty way you talked.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢你刚才瞅着梅·阿诺德的眼神,也不要喜欢你说话的傲慢的调子.

sentences.en: She's so snooty; she never speaks to the neighbours.
sentences.cn: 她很傲慢, 从不与邻居说话.

sentences.en: Snooty He's too snooty to associate with his old friends now he's rich.
sentences.cn: 他现在富了,竟妄自尊大不屑与老朋友来往了.

words.tran_cn: 傲慢的，自大的；目中无人的

trans.tran_en: rude and unfriendly, because you think you are better than other people
